result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Scott Tinkle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian Scott Tinkle is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian Scott Tinkle was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2 and 3.
Defendant to report to Probation today August 6, 2015 by 4:00 p.m.
Court notes 5 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

JOC from the PO as Return to Sender, Vacant, Unable to Forward. gme
Notice of Motion to Suppress Statements and Motion to Suppress Evidence. Filed by Atty Andrea. km
c: Def, Atty, DA, SCSO & E: Probation. eif
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Denise S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes and Megan Kelly  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Brian Scott Tinkle appeared from jail. Case called at 10:30 a.m. Atty Andrea states there is a resolution. Joint recommendation to amend charge to misdemeanor, probation, court costs and no contact with victim. ADA Nieskes has had contact with victim. Gives recommendations. Amend to misdemeanor bail jumping.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 1 in 15CF357. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended  Ct 1, Misd. Bail Jumping in 15CF357. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 & 3  in 15CF357 . Sentencing arguments. Defendant apologizes to the court for previous actions.  Crt orders:

- S/W 1 year probation. Report to probation by 4 p.m. today. Credit for 5 days jail if probation is revoked.

- Provide DNA Sample

- Court costs $243.00 and DNA Surcharge $200.00. Set up a payment plan

- Follow all rules and recommendations of the probation agent

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Denise Sargent.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. PER APPROVAL OF PROBATION AGENT, MAY BE LIFTED.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea,  DF:  Brian Scott Tinkle appeared from jail.  Defendant apologizes to the Court for his childish behavior yesterday.  Court accepts Defendant's apology.  Court will amend jail sentence to 1 - credit for time served.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian Scott Tinkle
Current: 7650 Tower Road, Siren, WI 54872  (Effective: 08-03-2015)
Prior: 503 Bay Street, St. Paul, MN 55102 
per Defendant in court. eif

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Denise S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: RMW, RPR: Erin Drost, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Alex Andrea   DF:  Brian Scott Tinkle appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. ADA Nieskes requests some cash, Atty Andrea argues. Request speedy prelim. Court orders findings and fact at 2:22 p.m. on the record, Defendant in open court did engage in disorderly fashion, was disruptive and used profanity. Court imposes a sentence of 2 days jail (imprisonment).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 10:00 am.
